intro: Linanthastrum pachyphyllum, commonly known as the thick-leaved broom. It is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands, characterized by its dense, woody growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its arid environment. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes. Linanthastrum pachyphyllum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to coastal and semi-arid conditions.
